content.raw:
No I didn’t try yet to run the `codecheck` target locally. Excluding the warning about a variable in the test \(which seems correct IMO\), I get the following error, not really sure what’s going on:  

```
❯ VERBOSE=1 make codecheck
/usr/bin/cmake -S/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo -B/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8 --check-build-system CMakeFiles/Makefile.cmake 0
make -f CMakeFiles/Makefile2 codecheck
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
/usr/bin/cmake -S/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo -B/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8 --check-build-system CMakeFiles/Makefile.cmake 0
/usr/bin/cmake -E cmake_progress_start /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8/CMakeFiles 0
make -f CMakeFiles/Makefile2 CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/all
make[2]: Entering directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
make -f CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/build.make CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/depend
make[3]: Entering directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
cd /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8 && /usr/bin/cmake -E cmake_depends "Unix Makefiles" /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8 /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8 /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8/CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/DependInfo.cmake --color=
make[3]: Leaving directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
make -f CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/build.make CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/build
make[3]: Entering directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
/usr/bin/cppcheck -q --inline-suppr -j 4 --language=c++ --std=c++14 --force --enable=style,performance,portability,information -I /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8 /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/integration /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/regression /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/performance -UM_PI\ --rule-file=/rl/local/share/ignition/ignition-cmake2/codecheck/header_guard.rule\ --rule-file=/rl/local/share/ignition/ignition-cmake2/codecheck/namespace_AZ.rule `/usr/bin/find /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/src /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/include /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/integration /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/regression /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/performance -name '*.cc' -o -name '*.hh' -o -name '*.c' -o -name '*.h'`
[/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/integration/physics_system.cc:624]: (style) The scope of the variable 'firstRun' can be reduced.
[/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/integration/physics_system.cc:710]: (style) The scope of the variable 'firstRun' can be reduced.
/usr/bin/cppcheck -q --inline-suppr -j 4 --language=c++ --std=c++14 --force --enable=missingInclude `/usr/bin/find /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/src /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/include /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/integration /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/regression /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/performance -name '*.cc' -o -name '*.hh' -o -name '*.c' -o -name '*.h'`
python /rl/local/share/ignition/ignition-cmake2/codecheck/cpplint.py --extensions=cc,hh --quiet `/usr/bin/find /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/src /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/include /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/integration /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/regression /home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/test/performance -name '*.cc' -o -name '*.hh' -o -name '*.c' -o -name '*.h'`
CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/build.make:57: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/codecheck' failed
make[3]: *** [CMakeFiles/codecheck] Error 1
make[3]: Leaving directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:711: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/all' failed
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/all] Error 2
make[2]: Leaving directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:718: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/rule' failed
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/codecheck.dir/rule] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/dferigo/git/ign-gazebo/build8'
Makefile:483: recipe for target 'codecheck' failed
make: *** [codecheck] Error 2
```

I checked and `cpplint.py` exists and has the right permissions. Executing that line in the terminal fails with exit code 1 without any output \(I also tried to remove the `--quiet ` option\).
